Hi there,

As a novice to REST, the first area of discomfort I've found is =
with
delivery guarantee -at least with respect to HTTP flavoured REST.
For =
example if a GET returns a list of resources how we do the list is
complete=
 without some annoyingly superficial xml wrapper.

So http://mydomain/api/o=
rders/?fromDate=3D20050101&thruDate=3D20050131
returning text/plain:

http:=
//mydomain/api/order/1001
http://mydomain/api/order/1002
http://mydomain/ap=
i/order/1003

I feel the need to need to garnish it as application/xml
<res=
t-request> [or perhaps <order> ]
http://mydomain/api/order/1001
http://mydo=
main/api/order/1002
http://mydomain/api/order/1003
</rest-request>

Likewis=
e this allows for an empty response
<rest-request/>

But most of the REST e=
xamples I've seen (so far) follow the first
pattern. Can some kind soul hel=
p me with what I'm missing?

Thanks and regards
Colin.
